snippet: The runaway train that exploded, killing 47 people and destroying much of Lac-Mégantic, Quebec, was far more volatile than signs on its tank cars indicated, investigators said.
abstract: Transportation Safety Board of Canada investigators say crude oil on a runaway train that derailed, exploded and destroyed much of Lac-Megantic, Quebec, killing 47 people, was far more volatile than warning signs on its tank cars indicated.
lead_paragraph: The runaway train that exploded, killing 47 people and destroying much of Lac-Mégantic, Quebec, was far more volatile than signs on its tank cars indicated, investigators said.

headline.main: Canada: Crude Oil in Runaway Train Was Mislabeled
headline.print_headline: Canada: Crude Oil in Runaway Train Was Mislabeled
